title: How to Make a Wax Embellished Aged Paper Card (Using a Microwave)

steps.headline: Get a blank sheet of paper.
Write something on it before you do anything else.
Crumple up the sheet of paper.
steps.description: This will ensure that it has lots of crevices, looking much more like old paper.

steps.headline: Make some black tea.
steps.description: You will only need one cup of tea, so heat some water in the microwave (make sure it is a microwavable cup), then put a teabag in it and let the water absorb a little bit. Be sure that the color is not too light; while it may seem too dark for the impression of aged paper, but appearances deceive.

steps.headline: Find a big platter or something flat and big enough to hold your piece of paper.
steps.description: Soak the teabag and squeeze it over the paper; rub gently. Don't be afraid to make little tears here and there, you'll have to do that to make it look old anyway. If you're using coffee, use a paintbrush and brush gently. If you want it to dry faster use a hairdryer.

steps.headline: Make a wax seal.
steps.description: Chip a few chunks of wax off a red candle; don't try this on a burning one though!

steps.headline: Put the chunks in a microwavable cup and microwave for sessions of thirty seconds.
steps.description: When most of it is melted, pour it into a small measuring cup.

steps.headline: Pour it onto the center of the card (pour as little as possible).
Use a coin or a button and press it on top of the wax seal.
steps.description: Don't take it off if there is resistance when you try to take it off.

text: Making the old card Get a blank sheet of paper.  Write something on it before you do anything else.  Crumple up the sheet of paper. This will ensure that it has lots of crevices, looking much more like old paper. Make some black tea. You will only need one cup of tea, so heat some water in the microwave (make sure it is a microwavable cup), then put a teabag in it and let the water absorb a little bit. Be sure that the color is not too light; while it may seem too dark for the impression of aged paper, but appearances deceive. Find a big platter or something flat and big enough to hold your piece of paper. Soak the teabag and squeeze it over the paper; rub gently. Don't be afraid to make little tears here and there, you'll have to do that to make it look old anyway. If you're using coffee, use a paintbrush and brush gently. If you want it to dry faster use a hairdryer. Adding finishing touches Make a wax seal. Chip a few chunks of wax off a red candle; don't try this on a burning one though! Put the chunks in a microwavable cup and microwave for sessions of thirty seconds. When most of it is melted, pour it into a small measuring cup. Pour it onto the center of the card (pour as little as possible).  Use a coin or a button and press it on top of the wax seal. Don't take it off if there is resistance when you try to take it off. Done. This is the finished product.
